Package com.rikuthin.entities.bullets

Class BulletSpawner

java.lang.Object
com.rikuthin.entities.Entity
com.rikuthin.entities.bullets.BulletSpawner
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updateable
public class BulletSpawner extends Entity
Represents an invisible Bullet spawner controlled by a game Entity.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Modifier and Type

    • setBulletAnimationKeys

      public final void setBulletAnimationKeys(Set<String> bulletAnimationKeys) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the set of keys this entity can query AnimationTemplateRepository with.
      Parameters:
      bulletAnimationKeys - The set of animation keys.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if, when a non-null set is passed, it contains null or blank keys, or contains a key that doesn't exist in AnimationTemplateRepository's key set.

    • setCurrentBulletAnimationKey

      public final void setCurrentBulletAnimationKey(String key) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the animation for the entity.

      Key must either be null (for no animation) or a valid (non-blank) string.

      Valid strings must be a AnimationTemplate key within AnimationTemplateRepository and must exist within the entity's current key set.

      Parameters:
      key - The key identifying the animation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided key (when not null) is blank, is not within the entity's animation key set, or does not map to a loaded template within AnimationTemplateRepository.

    • getBulletSpriteDimensions

      public Dimension getBulletSpriteDimensions()
      Returns the width and height (in pixels) of the first sprite in the bullet's animation as a Dimension object.
      Returns:
      A Dimension object representing the sprite's dimensions.

    • spawnBullet

      public Bullet spawnBullet()
      Spawns a new Bullet instance using the current stored values.

      The new bullet is also automatically added to the BulletRepository.

      Returns:
      the newly created bullet.
